intro: Ipomoea marginata f. candida, commonly known as the white morning glory, is a variant of the morning glory family (Convolvulaceae) characterized by its pale to white flowers. This trailing perennial vine features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms that open in the early morning. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a ground cover. Its flowers emit a mild fragrance and are pollinated primarily by insects.
